reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Decentralizing and improving the national TB response and expanding HIV differentiated prevention services to key and vulnerable populations

description.narrative: Guinea - TB/HIV - Plan International, Inc. - Plan Guinea. This program has the following goals: Réduire de façon significative le poids de la tuberculose dans la population guinéenne en vue d’atteindre les cibles de la stratégie mondiale End TB. De 2018 à 2022, les nouvelles infections sont réduites de 50%. De 2018 à 2022, la mortalité et la morbidité des PVVIH sont réduites d'au moins 62%. The objectives of this program are: Renforcer la capacité et la qualité du diagnostic de la tuberculose et intensifier le dépistage parmi les populations vulnérables et les groupes à risque de façon à accroitre de 2,2% par an le nombre de cas de tuberculose détectés et mis au traitement.. Améliorer le taux de succès thérapeutique de 79% en 2014 à 87% en 2020.. Réaliser le dépistage du VIH pour au moins 97% des patients tuberculeux et faire bénéficier au moins 95% des malades coinfectés du traitement ARV.. Détecter la résistance à la rifampicine chez au moins 90% des malades en retraitement et mettre sous traitement de deuxième ligne au moins 95% des cas confirmés TB-RR/MR.. Etendre le DOTS communautaire dans 20 Préfectures/communes non couvertes de sorte qu’au moins 25% des patients présumés tuberculeux soient référés par un agent communautaire et 20% des malades tuberculeux soient suivis par un agent communautaire; développer le partenariat avec les secteurs parapublic et privé.. Renforcer les capacités de gestion et de suivi du PNLAT de façon à atteindre un taux de réalisation d’au moins 80% à partir de 2019 pour les activités programmatiques planifiées dans le PAO.. De 2018 à 2022, la proportion de transmission du VIH est réduite de 80% parmi les enfants nés de mères séropositives. D'ici a fin 2022, la proportion des PVVIH enfants et adultes qui survivent 12 mois après le début du traitement ARV est portee a 90%. De 2018 à 2022, au moins 80% de populations clés (PS et HSH) adoptent un comportement à moindre risque face au IST/VIH. De 2018 à 2022, au moins 80% des jeunes de 10 à 24 ans adoptent un comportement à moindre risque face aux IST/VIH

title.narrative: Outcome indicator for GIN-C-PLAN
Case notification rate of all forms of TB per 100,000 population - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a non regular partner
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a male partner
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Percentage of sex workers reporting the use of a condom with their most recent client
Coverage / Output indicator for GIN-C-PLAN
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
Timeliness of facility reporting: Percentage of submitted facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are received on time per the national guidelines
Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received
Percentage of men who have sex with men that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of men who have sex with men reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified
Number of children <5 in contact with TB patients who began isonizide preventive therapy
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment
Percentage of registered new and relapse TB patients with documented HIV status
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – community referrals
Percentage of health facilities with tracer medicines for the three diseases available on the day of the visit or day of reporting
Percentage of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Number of people in contact with TB patients who began preventive therapy

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Impact indicator for GIN-C-PLAN
TB incidence rate per 100,000 population
TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
Percentage of sex workers who are living with HIV
Percentage of men who have sex with men who are living with HIV
